info.title: AzureArcDataManagementClient
info.description: The AzureArcData management API provides a RESTful set of web APIs to manage Azure Data Services on Azure Arc Resources.

put.description: Creates or replaces an Arc Sql Server Availability Group.

parameters.name: sqlServerAvailabilityGroupResource
parameters.description: The request body for availability group resource.

delete.description: Deletes an Arc Sql Server availability group resource.

Location.description: The URL of the resource used to check the status of the asynchronous operation.

204.description: The specified availability group does not exist.

get.description: Retrieves an Arc Sql Server availability group.

parameters.name: sqlServerAvailabilityGroupUpdate
parameters.description: The requested server availability group resource state.

Location.description: The URL of the resource used to check the status of the asynchronous operation.

post.description: Retrieves detailed properties of the Availability Group.

200.description: Successfully retrieved the Run-time detailed properties of the Availability Group.

post.description: Request manual failover of the availability group to this server.

200.description: Successfully requested failover of the Availability Group.

post.description: Request forced failover of the availability group to this server.

200.description: Successfully requested forced failover of the Availability Group.

post.description: Create a SQL Server availability group

parameters.name: createAgConfiguration
parameters.description: The configuration for the new SQL Server availability group resource.

202.description: Availability group creation is in progress.

Location.description: The URL of the resource used to check the status of the asynchronous operation.

post.description: Create a SQL Server distributed availability group

parameters.name: createDagConfiguration
parameters.description: The configuration for the new SQL Server availability group resource.

202.description: Availability group creation is in progress.

Location.description: The URL of the resource used to check the status of the asynchronous operation.

post.description: Request adding database(s) to an existing availability group.

parameters.name: databases
parameters.description: The database names to add to the SQL Server availability group resource.

200.description: Successfully requested adding databases to Availability Group.

post.description: Request removing database(s) from an existing availability group.

parameters.name: databases
parameters.description: The database names to remove from the SQL Server availability group resource.

200.description: Successfully requested removing databases from Availability Group.

get.summary: List the availability group associated with the given Arc Sql Server.

AvailabilityGroupConfigure.description: The specifications of the availability group replica configuration

endpointName.description: Name of the mirroring endpoint URL

endpointUrl.description: Mirroring endpoint URL of availability group replica

endpointAuthenticationMode.description: Permitted authentication modes for the mirroring endpoint.

certificateName.description: Name of certificate to use for authentication. Required if any CERTIFICATE authentication modes are specified.

endpointConnectLogin.description: The login which will connect to the mirroring endpoint.

availabilityMode.description: Property that determines whether a given availability replica can run in synchronous-commit mode

availabilityModeDescription.description: The Availability Synchronization mode of the availability group replica.

failoverMode.description: Property to set the failover mode of the availability group replica

failoverModeDescription.description: The failover mode of the availability group replica.

sessionTimeout.description: The time-out period of availability group session replica, in seconds.

primaryAllowConnections.description: Whether the primary replica should allow all connections or only READ_WRITE connections (disallowing ReadOnly connections)

primaryRoleAllowConnectionsDescription.description: Whether the availability allows all connections or only read-write connections.

secondaryAllowConnections.description: Whether the secondary replica should allow all connections, no connections, or only ReadOnly connections.

secondaryRoleAllowConnectionsDescription.description: Whether an availability replica that is performing the secondary role (that is, a secondary replica) can accept connections from clients.

replicaCreateDate.description: Date that the replica was created.

replicaModifyDate.description: Date that the replica was modified.

backupPriority.description: Represents the user-specified priority for performing backups on this replica relative to the other replicas in the same availability group.

readOnlyRoutingUrl.description: Connectivity endpoint (URL) of the read only availability replica.

readWriteRoutingUrl.description: Connectivity endpoint (URL) of the read write availability replica.

seedingMode.description: Specifies how the secondary replica will be initially seeded. AUTOMATIC enables direct seeding. This method will seed the secondary replica over the network. This method does not require you to backup and restore a copy of the primary database on the replica. MANUAL specifies manual seeding (default). This method requires you to create a backup of the database on the primary replica and manually restore that backup on the secondary replica.

AvailabilityGroupState.description: The specifications of the availability group state

availabilityGroupReplicaRole.description: Current Always On availability groups role of the availability group replica.

operationalStateDescription.description: Current operational state of the availability group replica

recoveryHealthDescription.description: Recovery health of the availability group replica.

synchronizationHealthDescription.description: Reflects a rollup of the database synchronization state (synchronization_state) of all joined availability databases (also known as replicas) and the availability mode of the replica (synchronous-commit or asynchronous-commit mode). The rollup will reflect the least healthy accumulated state the databases on the replica.

connectedStateDescription.description: Whether a secondary replica is currently connected to the primary replica.

lastConnectErrorDescription.description: Text description of the last connection error of the availability group replica.

lastConnectErrorTimestamp.description: Date and time timestamp indicating when the last connect error occurred.

AvailabilityGroupInfo.description: The specifications of the availability group state

failureConditionLevel.description: User-defined failure condition level under which an automatic failover must be triggered.

healthCheckTimeout.description: Wait time (in milliseconds) for the sp_server_diagnostics system stored procedure to return server-health information, before the server instance is assumed to be slow or not responding.

automatedBackupPreferenceDescription.description: Preferred location for performing backups on the availability databases in this availability group.

version.description: SQL Server availability group current version.

basicFeatures.description: Specifies whether this is a basic availability group.

dtcSupport.description: Specifies whether DTC support has been enabled for this availability group.

dbFailover.description: Specifies whether the availability group supports failover for database health conditions.

isDistributed.description: Specifies whether this is a distributed availability group.

clusterTypeDescription.description: SQL Server availability group cluster type description

requiredSynchronizedSecondariesToCommit.description: The number of secondary replicas that must be in a synchronized state for a commit to complete.

isContained.description: SQL Server availability group contained system databases.

primaryReplica.description: Name of the server instance that is hosting the current primary replica.

primaryRecoveryHealthDescription.description: Indicates the recovery health of the primary replica.

secondaryRecoveryHealthDescription.description: Indicates the recovery health of a secondary replica.

synchronizationHealthDescription.description: Reflects a roll-up of the synchronization health of all availability replicas in the availability group.

listener.description: The listener for the sql server availability group

AvailabilityGroupCreateUpdateConfigurati.description: Options used in creating an availability group

databases.description: List of databases to include in the availability group.

automatedBackupPreference.description: Preferred replica for running automated backups.

failureConditionLevel.description: User-defined failure condition level under which an automatic failover must be triggered.

healthCheckTimeout.description: Wait time (in milliseconds) for the sp_server_diagnostics system stored procedure to return server-health information, before the server instance is assumed to be slow or not responding.

dbFailover.description: Specifies whether the availability group supports failover for database health conditions.

dtcSupport.description: Specifies whether DTC support has been enabled for this availability group.

requiredSynchronizedSecondariesToCommit.description: The number of secondary replicas that must be in a synchronized state for a commit to complete.

clusterType.description: Set to WSFC when availability group is on a failover cluster instance on a Windows Server failover cluster. Set to NONE when availability group not using WSFC for cluster coordination.

listener.description: The listener for the sql server availability group

AvailabilityGroupCreateUpdateReplicaConf.description: The specifications of the availability group replica configuration

serverInstance.description: the server instance hosting the replica.

endpointName.description: Name of the database mirroring endpoint URL for the availability group replica

endpointUrl.description: Database mirroring endpoint URL of availability group replica

endpointAuthenticationMode.description: Permitted authentication modes for the mirroring endpoint.

certificateName.description: Name of certificate to use for authentication. Required if any CERTIFICATE authentication modes are specified.

endpointConnectLogin.description: The login which will connect to the mirroring endpoint

availabilityMode.description: Property that determines whether a given availability replica can run in synchronous-commit mode

failoverMode.description: Property to set the failover mode of the availability group replica

seedingMode.description: Specifies how the secondary replica will be initially seeded. AUTOMATIC enables direct seeding. This method will seed the secondary replica over the network. This method does not require you to backup and restore a copy of the primary database on the replica. MANUAL specifies manual seeding (default). This method requires you to create a backup of the database on the primary replica and manually restore that backup on the secondary replica.

backupPriority.description: Represents the user-specified priority for performing backups on this replica relative to the other replicas in the same availability group.

secondaryRoleAllowConnections.description: Whether the secondary replica should allow all connections, no connections, or only ReadOnly connections.

secondaryRoleReadOnlyRoutingUrl.description: Connectivity endpoint (URL) of the read only availability replica.

primaryRoleAllowConnections.description: Whether the primary replica should allow all connections or only READ_WRITE connections (disallowing ReadOnly connections)

primaryRoleReadOnlyRoutingList.description: List of read only routing URLs.

sessionTimeout.description: The time-out period of availability group session replica, in seconds.

ArcSqlServerAvailabilityGroupListResult.description: A list of Arc Sql Server Availability Groups.

value.description: Array of Arc Sql Server Availability Groups.

nextLink.description: Link to retrieve next page of results.

DistributedAvailabilityGroupCreateUpdate.description: Options used in creating a distributed availability group.

primaryAvailabilityGroup.description: The initial primary availability group for the distributed availability group.

secondaryAvailabilityGroup.description: The initial secondary availability group for the distributed availability group.

DistributedAvailabilityGroupCreateUpdate.description: The availability group configuration specification for a distributed availability group.

availabilityGroup.description: The azure resource identifier for the availability group.

listenerUrl.description: The listener URL of the availability group.

availabilityMode.description: The availability mode of the availability group.

failoverMode.description: The failover mode of the availability group.

seedingMode.description: The seeding mode of the availability group.

certificateConfiguration.description: The certificate configuration for the availability group.

properties.description: Properties of Arc Sql Server availability group

SqlServerAvailabilityGroupResourceProper.description: The properties of Arc Sql Server availability group resource

availabilityGroupId.description: ID GUID of the availability group.

collectionTimestamp.description: Timestamp for when the data was collected from the client machine.

replicas.description: A list of Availability Group Replicas.

nextLink.description: Link to retrieve next page of results.

databases.description: A list of Availability Group Database Replicas.

value.description: Array of Availability Group Database Replicas.

nextLink.description: Link to retrieve next page of results.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the Arc-enabled SQL Server availability group resource.

SqlServerAvailabilityGroupUpdate.description: An update to availability group resource.

SqlAvailabilityGroupReplicaResourcePrope.description: The properties of Arc Sql availability group replica resource

replicaId.description: ID GUID of the availability group.

SqlAvailabilityGroupDatabaseReplicaResou.description: The properties of Arc Sql availability group database replica resource

isLocal.description: Whether the availability database is local.

isPrimaryReplica.description: Returns 1 if the replica is primary, or 0 if it is a secondary replica.

isCommitParticipant.description: Whether this replica is transaction committer.

synchronizationHealthDescription.description: Description of the health of database.

databaseStateDescription.description: Description of the database state of the availability replica.

isSuspended.description: Whether this data movement is suspended.

suspendReasonDescription.description: Description of the database suspended state reason.

SqlAvailabilityGroupStaticIPListenerProp.description: The properties of a static IP Arc Sql availability group listener

dnsName.description: the DNS name for the listener.

ipV4AddressesAndMasks.description: IP V4 Addresses and masks for the listener.

ipV6Addresses.description: IP V6 Addresses for the listener

port.description: Network port for the listener. Default is 1433.

SqlAvailabilityGroupIpV4AddressesAndMask.description: Address and netmask information for an IPv4 AG listener.

SqlAvailabilityGroupDhcpListenerProperti.description: The properties of a DHCP Arc Sql availability group listener

dnsName.description: the DNS name for the listener.

subnet.description: The IPV4 subnet for the listener.

port.description: Network port for the listener. Default is 1433.

resourceGroupName.name: resourceGroupName
resourceGroupName.description: The name of the Azure resource group
